page.title: 15LAMPLUGH DISABLED RIDING
page.content: The Disabled Riders Club based at Kerbeck Ponies, Felldyke has been going for two and a half years. There are three people who work full time and six who work at the weekends. There are about thirty disabled riders riding each month. The disabled riders are taken for rides around a field. The disabled people really enjoy riding because they are free to move about when they are on the horses. The people from the club lift the disabled people onto the horses, some people have to be strapped on. There are twenty three ponies, the oldest one is Falcon who is fifteen. The disabled riders come from Hensingham and Distington. There are three other Disabled Riders Clubs in the county, they are at Kendal, Penrith and Carlisle.
